snippet: The move is aimed at bridging the digital divide at a time when one in five people don’t have broadband Internet access at home.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission approves $9.25 monthly broadband subsidy plan that will facilitate Internet connections for millions of low-income households; intent is to provide bridge to vast numbers of poor Americans that need high-speed Internet connections for tasks as basic as schoolwork and finding jobs.
lead_paragraph: The move is aimed at bridging the digital divide at a time when one in five people don’t have broadband Internet access at home.

headline.main: F.C.C. Approves Broadband Subsidy for Low-Income Households
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Approves Broadband Subsidy to Help Low-Income Households Get Online
